clinical_study.brief_title: Post-operative Functional Disability in Unrecognized Cognitive Impairment (POF) Study
clinical_study.official_title: Post-operative Functional Disability in Unrecognized Cognitive Impairment (POF) Study: an Observational Cohort Study in Patients Undergoing Non-cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective multicenter cohort study, which will determine the predictive value of the Modified Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status (TICS-M), Eight-items interview to Differentiate Aging and Dementia(AD8), and a single cognitive question in detecting the trajectory of cognitive impairment (CI) pre- and post-operatively in geriatric surgical patients. This study will target geriatric patients from the pre-operative clinics at Toronto Western Hospital, Toronto General Hospital, and Mount Sinai Hospital, Toronto. Research staff will identify eligible patients who are scheduled for elective non-cardiac surgery. Written informed consent to participate in the study will be obtained from all patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary aim of this study is to determine the prevalence of unrecognized cognitive impairment (CI) pre-operatively in older surgical adults through measurement via virtual instruments.
In a preoperative assessment 1-30 days prior to their scheduled surgery, patients will be asked via telephone to complete TICS-M and will complete the AD8, a single cognitive question, World Health Organization Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0 (WHODAS 2.0), Instrumental Activity of Daily Living (IADL), EuroQol 5 Dimension (EQ-5D-5L), Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) via online survey. These questionnaires will be repeated at follow-up visits at 30-, 90-, and 365-days post-surgery. If patients agreed to have an informant participate in the study as well, then the informant will go through a similar consent process and will complete only the IADL at every time point in the study as separate submission.

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled to undergoing elective inpatient non-cardiac surgery under general and/ or regional anesthesia
